facts.1: All Saints' Day is celebrated on November 1st to honor all saints, known and unknown, in the Christian tradition.
facts.2: The day was established by Pope Gregory III in the 8th century and is observed by various Christian denominations.
facts.3: All Saints' Day is a public holiday in many countries and is often marked by attending church services and visiting cemeteries.

facts.1: National Author's Day is observed on November 1st to celebrate authors and their contributions to literature and culture.
facts.2: The day was established in 1928 by the General Federation of Women's Clubs to recognize the importance of authors in society.
facts.3: National Author's Day encourages people to read books, write reviews, and show appreciation for their favorite authors.

Day 3.title: National Cook for Your Pets Day

facts.1: National Cook for Your Pets Day is celebrated on November 1st to promote the preparation of healthy and nutritious meals for pets.
facts.2: The day encourages pet owners to cook homemade meals for their pets, ensuring they receive high-quality ingredients and balanced nutrition.
facts.3: National Cook for Your Pets Day highlights the importance of proper pet nutrition and the benefits of home-cooked meals for pets' health and well-being.
